# Gust - High-Performance HTTP Server Framework

> @sylphx/gust - HTTP server framework for Bun and Node.js with native Rust acceleration

## Overview

Gust is a high-performance HTTP server framework featuring:
- 220k+ requests/second with native Rust acceleration (Hyper + Tokio)
- Portable apps that run on Bun, Deno, Cloudflare Workers, AWS Lambda
- Type-safe routing with path parameter inference
- 20+ built-in middleware (auth, validation, rate limiting, etc.)
- Real-time support with WebSocket, SSE, and HTTP/2

## Installation

```bash
bun add @sylphx/gust
# or
npm install @sylphx/gust
```

## Quick Start

```typescript
import { createApp, serve, get, json, cors } from '@sylphx/gust'

const app = createApp({
  routes: [
    get('/', () => json({ message: 'Hello World!' })),
    get('/users/:id', ({ ctx }) => json({ id: ctx.params.id })),
  ],
  middleware: cors(),
})

await serve({ app, port: 3000 })
```

## Packages

- @sylphx/gust - Main package, re-exports everything
- @sylphx/gust-app - Portable app framework (serverless/edge)
- @sylphx/gust-server - Rust-powered HTTP server
- @sylphx/gust-core - WASM router and utilities

## Key Concepts

### Route Builders
- get(), post(), put(), patch(), del(), all() - Define routes
- routes('/prefix', [...]) - Group routes with prefix

### Response Helpers
- json(data, options?) - JSON response
- text(content) - Plain text response
- html(content) - HTML response
- redirect(url, status?) - Redirect response
- notFound(), badRequest(), unauthorized(), forbidden(), serverError()

### Middleware
- cors() - CORS headers
- rateLimit({ max, window }) - Rate limiting
- jwtAuth({ secret }) - JWT authentication
- validate({ body, query, params }) - Request validation
- compress() - Response compression
- session({ secret }) - Session management

### Validation
- object({ ... }) - Object schema
- string(), number(), boolean() - Primitives
- email(), url(), uuid() - String formats
- array(schema) - Array of items
- optional(schema), nullable(schema)

### Server Features
- serve({ app, port }) - Start HTTP server
- clusterServe({ app, workers }) - Multi-core cluster
- websocket({ open, message, close }) - WebSocket handler
- sse(generator) - Server-Sent Events
- streamFile(path) - File streaming
